page.title: 01KIRKWALL IN THE ORKNEYS
page.content: The main land cover in the 12km is intensively managed farmland because Orkney's main income is agriculture, especially beef and dairy farming. Another of Orkney's main sources of income is the oil terminal on the south island of Flotta. It has helped a great deal to increase Kirkwall's population. Most of these people are either locals or from other parts of Great Britain.There are very few foreigners in Orkney.A new industry just started is fish farming. Mostly salmon and oysters are farmed but also a few lobsters.There are only a few fish farms as yet, but soon it might become a profitable industry.The local industries include silvercraft, the designs on which are all connected with Orkney.Traditionally, wood was scarce and chairs were made of straw. These are still being made today.
